title: Can't choose a main
body: So I've been in bronze for a while and I would like to climb out, problem is I can't choose a champ to main, I play one for a while then get bored or find a flaw with them. I need a mid champion with mobility and can snowball. If anyone can help me stick with a single champion it would be awesome

replies.body:
{{champion:82}}  

If you spend maybe 30 games in him you will pubstomp bronze with always shield never die.
play fizz-has great mobility and can sowball really hard-trust me he is one of my so called "main champs"
or ahiri is really good as she has a better lane phase and great kill presure throughout the game

I'm probably going to get a lot of sh!t for saying this but, if you want a mid champion with mobility who can snowball that will get you out of bronze easier, Quinn is a viable option. There's a few things to consider though. If you choose the path of a Quinn main, expect lots of rage and queue dodging. The vast majority of the League community thinks Quinn is trash tier, which I'd say is fair enough **IF** you're talking about high elo (Diamond/Master/Challenger level), in low elo Quinn is an extremely powerful champion. Thing is she's rarely used anywhere so people don't get the experience of versing her and most people don't even consider that she'll be used so, in low elo at least, no one knows how to deal with her. I'd say she's even a hard counter for Master Yi, even a fed one (assuming low elo and that you know what you're doing).

Mind you it's not "play Quinn, gain elo". You need to put lots of effort into learning how to play her (I think it's fair to say she's one of the harder champions to master) and learning to deal with the nay-sayers. A good Quinn main could probably get low-mid Gold easily enough but getting much higher using Quinn will be a challenge in itself, so if you're wanting to get, say, platinum you'd probably be better off using someone else, or you could use Quinn to get to gold and then switch to a more "high elo friendly" champion. Another thing to consider, Quinn has bugs. There's a few bug that have been around for a long time, even one or two since I started playing Quinn around 2 years ago, and Riot's even attempted to fix one or two of them (and there was noticeable improvement but they're still there).

In the end it comes down to how you feel about it but if you're interested I'm more than willing to discuss further, all you need to do is ask.
I would prefer to pick a champion and learn them to take as high as I can without switching, but Quinn would work top and adc if I got stuck with those roles yes?
If you know what you're doing yes, Quinn will work Top (I prefer playing her top), ADC and even Support. I've not seen or heard of anyone successfully playing her in the jungle though.
I'll give Hera go, but having an ad champion mid reckon I'll be ok if I build armpen, even in bronze ppl will stack armour vs full ad teams

I find Armour Pen on Quinn is good, with a decent amount it seems to do better than just stacking AD, Attack Speed etc. Not to mention, Youmuu's Ghostblade is a pretty good item for Quinn in my opinion, providing AD, Armour Pen, Crit Chance, CDR, Attack Speed (active) and Movement Speed (active). Using the active at the right time (even with it's 45 sec cooldown) can make all the difference.
I'd say Ekko or Yasuo but if people in my elo struggle to play them then I'm not too sure how you'd go.

Every champion needs a flaw to be balanced.
If you're looking for OverPowered top of the meta champions then that should be easy to find. Just search them up, they're top meta after all.
"mid champion with mobility and can snowball" gee whiz havent heard that one before. i nearly felt sympathetic at your pleas of climbing out, glad i kept reading {{summoner:2}}
